Condition_summary_1: Sedimentation and erosion control measures must be in place and maintained to avoid sediment release into the watercourse.
Condition_summary_2: Total suspended sediment and turbidity monitoring must adhere to the plan in Appendix C of the 2018 Aquatic Effects Assessment.
Condition_summary_3: All riprap must be clean, free of fine materials, and not obtained from fish-frequented waters below the ordinary high water mark.
Condition_summary_4: Dewatering must direct water to vegetated areas or settling basins, ensuring water quality meets standards before returning to fish habitats.
Habitat_Type: fish habitat (specific type not explicitly stated beyond 'resident fish species' and 'fish-frequented waters')
Fish_species: resident fish species (specific species not listed)
Offset_footprint_size: 7,800 m² for the secondary channel regrading downstream
Vegetation_Cover: None explicitly mentioned beyond general requirements for sediment control and spoil disposal areas
Boulder: Natural structures like large boulders contributing to fish habitat must be stockpiled for replacement post-construction
Woody_coverage: Natural structures including woody debris must be stockpiled for replacement
Instream_structures: Berm construction and riprap placement are noted as in-stream activities with specific mitigation measures
